question: How did early British anthropology connect with British colonial rule?

answers.text: Meyer Fortes and E. E. Evans-Pritchard challenged European assumptions about African political organization being oppressive and chaotic.
Meyer Fortes and E. E. Evans-Pritchard hired anthropologists to produce political works of fiction that would support colonial advancement.
Early British anthropology avoided the study of political anthropology in order to avoid critiquing colonialism.
It inspired Max Weber to focus on power and authority in his studies of politics.
